DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping Frozen Section Outcome Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A text field for comments regarding the result of a frozen section specimen of the lymph node using sentinel lymph node mapping technique.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping Frozen Section Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique that uses dyes and/or radioactive agents to map the lymphatic drainage of an area in which a tumor is located, thereby identifying the sentinel node._A thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen, often used for rapid microscopic diagnosis._The result of an action._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure that detects early metastases to the lymph nodes of the axilla. A radioactive tracer material is injected into the tissue prior to surgery and an X-ray picture is taken to visualize the lymph node system. The surgeon uses a small probe to find the lymph node and if the sentinel lymph node is free of cancer, the other lymph nodes in the axilla may not need to be removed. This minimizes the risks and side effects of a full lymph node dissection.

Concepts.definition: A technique that uses dyes and/or radioactive agents to map the lymphatic drainage of an area in which a tumor is located, thereby identifying the sentinel node.

Property.preferredDefinition: A thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen, often used for rapid microscopic diagnosis.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen, often used for rapid microscopic diagnosis.
